newsitem.title: FRANCE: Canal Plus shocked by TF1 action.
newsitem.headline: Canal Plus shocked by TF1 action.

text.p: Canal Plus said it was stunned on Tuesday by French television channel TF1's judicial proceedings against Canal Plus to exclude sports cover from its merger with Dutch company Nethold.

TF1 chairman Patrick Le Lay told the newspaper La Tribune the firm had launched proceedings against Canal Plus "to demand the suspension of its merger with Nethold or, at least, the exclusion of all Nethold sports channels from the merger".
Le Lay said Canal Plus, which would take over Nethold's sports channels, was bound under an agreement with TF1 on Eurosport not to compete against the sports channel.
"Canal Plus has always defended the interests of Eurosport, in which it is a 33 percent shareholder," Canal Plus said in a statement.
"It's clear the merger with Nethold not only does not jeopardise the chain's interests but, on the contrary, offers new development prospects," it said.

"At a time when Canal Plus is developing French interests in Europe and internationally through the merger with Nethold, Canal Plus is stunned that a French company would make such an effort to undermine the international development of another French company," it said.
Canal Plus last month announced a plan to merge with Nethold, which is jointly held by the South African controlled industrial firm Richemont and MCL-Multi Choice Ltd.
